meanings.definition: A subdivision of a company of soldiers, typically consisting of two or more squads or sections.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the platoons moved strategically to secure the area.
meanings.sent2: The platoons trained together to improve their combat skills.
meanings.sent3: The platoons decided to have a race to see who could reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the platoons acted as chess pieces on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The platoons marched in perfect unison, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A group of people working together on a task or project.
meanings.sent1: The platoons of volunteers cleaned up the park in record time.
meanings.sent2: The platoons of chefs prepared a feast for the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The platoons of students organized a surprise party for their teacher.
meanings.sent4: In the office, the platoons brainstormed ideas for the new marketing campaign.
meanings.sent5: The platoons collaborated seamlessly, achieving great success.
